page.title: 02The Landscape.(East)
page.content: In the east is The Landing Beach which is the only place on the island which gives relatively easy access from the sea.A small track, clinging precariously to the cliffs,leads to the main settlement on the plateau- like top. The South Light tops the Lametor peninsula and is joined to the mass by a narrow saddle of crumbling shale. (Most of Lundy is granite but part of the S.E.is composed of some greatly contorted sedimentary rocks and the erosion has been very uneven). Further east is Rat Island which is accessable by wading at low tide.The spongy grassland and differing flora results from the lack of grazing.There is a natural tunnel which goes right under Rat Island. Above,Marisco Castle commands both the Landing Beach and the Bristol Channel.
